When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r, results='asis'}
definitions <- read.csv("~/Desktop/unitlabels/data/definitions.csv", stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
cat(definitions$symbol.md)
cat(definitions$units.md)
```

```{r}
labs<- c()
for(i in 1:length(definitions$symbol.R)){
  labs[i]<- parse(text=definitions$symbol.R[i])

}
plot(1:10,1:10, pch="")
text(seq(1,10,length.out =39),rep(1:6+1,39/6),labs, cex=0.7)

labs<- c()
for(i in 1:length(definitions$units.R)){
  labs[i]<- parse(text=definitions$units.R[i])

}
plot(1:10,1:10, pch="")
text(seq(1,10,length.out =39),rep(1:6+1,39/6),labs, cex=0.7)

uls("T.degC", output="R")
 ```
